name: EpidermalERKMAPK

screenshots.caption: SEDML time course output for executing EpidermalERKMAPK.xml at varying spatial positions

short_description:
A collection of scripts which examine the activation/phosphorylation of ERK-MAPK signalling components across the depth of human epidermis. This code accompanies the publication (currently under review): Cursons, J. et al (2015). Regulation of ERK-MAPK Signalling in Human Epidermis. BMC Systems Biology. doi: not-yet-known

The model was developed using a set the normalized-Hill differential equation framework, as specified by [Kraeutler, Soltis & Saucerman, (2002). BMC Systems Biology; doi: 10.1186/1752-0509-4-157].

This package includes:
- MATLAB code containing the model definition, together with a script to perform non-linear least squares optimisation for a subset of parameters
- python scripts which use libSBML to create an SBML representation of the model
- SED-ML scripts which execute the SBML model under a range of conditions, produce output plots to recapitulate results shown in Cursons et al. (2015).
summary: Scripts for Modelling Human Epidermal ERK-MAPK Activation
